title: Youtube Videos Never Loading?
content:
Hi all-

I've recently switched to firefox and my only complaint is that Youtube does not appear to be functioning it well. Frequently videos will just never load, remaining a black screen with the circle spinning. The rest of the page loads, but not the video itself. I've left one of these pages open for four hours and it did not load at all during that time.

Once I had a video that was playing just fine, and I accidentally hit another video on the side of the screen. When I went back to the one that had been playing, it was now a black screen and the endless loading circle.

There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to which videos will actually play and which will not, other than I've noticed it happen a bit more frequently on videos uploaded in the past twenty four hours.

I've uninstalled the browser and reinstalled it, cleared my cookies and cache, made sure firefox is up to date, everything I can think of doing. I've not been able to find anyone else mentioning having an issue with this. No other browser on my laptop seems to do this with youtube, just firefox.

Any suggestions? It's getting pretty frustrating.

title: Downloading files fails, Ubuntu snap install, possible workaround
content:
After visiting many sites, and removing and reinstalling the snap, logging out of sync, using troubleshooting mode, and a few other tests, I figured out that checking the "Always ask you where to save files" disables downloading. When I click to download, the page refresh button cycles and no other action occurs, there should be a pop-up to give choice about where to download the file.

I assume it has to do with file permissions with snap and the possibility of going outside of /home. Once I unclick "always ask.." I am able to download again.

Firefox 104, Ubuntu 22.04. Brand new OS install.
creator: klapenotiere

title: Field entries not recognised
content:
I've been using Firefox on my PC for some years now, but occasionally I have experienced problems associated with filling requested fields. Today's example was a form for arranging a parcel to be collected by DPD. I filled-in the required fields for postcodes for source and destinations. Instead of progressing to the next stage I was asked to enter valid postcodes, apparently not recognising what I'd entered. I did that twice with the same result. I then copied the URL from the top of the screen, and opened it in Microsoft Edge, and I was then able to continue successfully.

That has happened on several occasions over the years, indicating a background fault with Firefox. I'd hate to migrate away from Firefox over such a small problem, but it's something that needs looking into. I apologise if this issue has been notified before, but to date it hasn't been rectified.

title: Firefox prefers IPv4 address in a dual-stack environment
content:
Hi,

I'm using IPv4 as well as IPv6 addresses in my home network. But Firefox uses always the IPv4 connection when I open a website. When I open the same website in MS Edge, the IPv6 connection is used.

I've captured the network traffic during opening a website in Firefox, which is reachable over IPv4 and IPv6. First I see two DNS queries (A and AAAA) for the domain name. Both responses containing the correct IP address, and they arrive nearly at the same time at the client. Next I can see the TCP handshake. But it's send between the IPv4 address only. No IPv6 connection was attempted.

When I run the IPv6 test at https://test-ipv6.com, the IPv6 resuls are nearly fine. Only the web browser test says "Your browser has real working IPv6 address - but is avoiding using it."

When I run the same test in MS Edge, all tests are fine.

So it seems that this is not a OS or network issue. It affects Firefox only.

What I've already tried:

  • Disabled all extensions
  • Created a new profile
  • Used the IPv6 address of the website instead of the FQDN -> Works fine.
  • Checked DNS cache of Firefox (about:networking). It contains the IPv4 and IPv6 addresses of the requested websites

I guess that Firefox prefers the A record for some reason. But I've no idea why. Has anybody an idea what could causing this?

Thanks.

Jas Man
creator: JasMan1978

title: Zoom meeting links not opening
content:
This morning I re-installed an update to Zoom (on Linux - ElementaryOS / Ubuntu 18.04). Since installing, I've not been able to follow links from Firefox to Zoom (zoommtg links don't open the app). However, they still work from Epiphany.

The slight confounding factor is that I realised that I've been updated to FF 104 overnight, so that might be an issue.

I've been looking at network.protocol-handler.... settings in about:config, based on this article: https://superuser.com/questions/1343020/how-to-configure-firefox-open-zoom-urls-using-zoom-application#1351073

I've also been looking at xdg-settings (based on this article) https://www.reddit.com/r/kde/comments/i83m8i/zoom_desktop_client_isnt_launching_from_browser/ which suggests the problems might be to do with xdg-settings calling /usr/share/applications/zoom.desktop when the available file is /usr/share/applications/Zoom.desktop However, I have not been able to alter the xdg-settings parameter - when I try: $ xdg-settings set default-url-scheme-handler zoommtg zoom.desktop it does not change the setting - it remains as Zoom.desktop

I should mention that the version of FF I'm running is delivered as a snap - but this was not a problem before 104 / my latest Zoom installation. Also, this version of FF has no problem opening up MS Teams meetings or Slack groups. handlers.json includes : ... "slack":{"action":4},"snap":{"action":4},"zoommtg":{"action":4},"msteams":{"action":4}}, .... so I am thinking the problem must lie somewhee else.

Any suggestions would be gratefully received.

thanks Andy
creator: andydeardentsa

title: Firefox on PC - sync issues
content:
Hi I have 2 almost identical PCs one a Surface Pro 7 and the other a Surface Pro 8. I have had a *lot* of issues trying to sync between these two. I keep getting spurious old data (bookmarks etc), regardless of what I do. I have tried this: Both computers logged out from Sync. On the computer I want to keep the current settings on and send to other computer - set all bookmarks, logins etc as wanted - log in to Sync and sync - log out of sync. On second computer which I want to be identical to first one, log in to sync - wait a while - log out of sync. This sort of works, but there are always extra items and/or some items that didn't seem to sync correctly. There are always extra bookmarks that neither computer started with, and, duplicated entries in passwords and login data.

Question 1: how do I 'clear out' all data currently held by Sync so I can start fresh? Question 2: if the answer to question 1 is to delete firefox account and recreate, then, would the above procedure work correctly without extra's and duplicates?

I feel the term 'Sync' is misused in firefox when spurious old data not on either machine is introduced to both when syncing. In my opinion, a better way to achieve everything would be to have an option to 'clear and copy' from this computer so that on any other computer, you can be sure of identical data after sync.

title: Firefox all kinds of problems
content:
Hello, for some reason firefox has decided to basically disintegrate on my system, seems like everytime I open it there is a new problem.

First it was forgetting saved log in information, not all of it just now and then one or two of my most commonly used log ins just vanished from firefox and I had to type and save them again.

Then it stopped showing bookmarks in my address bar. For years I have been able to access youtube by simply typing the letter y and duckduckgo just by typing in d because address bar would show my saved bookmarks at the top and allow me to click the full link. Now it doens't show them at all, even if i type in youtube.com firefox no longer suggests my www.youtube.com bookmark. Not a single time in about a decade of using this platform have I needed to use * to get m bookmarks to show but now I need to do both * and type the full link before the address bar realizes that I already have the destination bookmarked.

Then there was a problem with uploads, I use speedtest.net to keep an eye on my speed and for some reason, specific to firefox alone it cannot upload, every test on every server, with and without vpn gives an error about uploading. Despite the settings in my vpn client, my internet options, firefox's own settings, firewall and my router all being set to allow the traffic.

It also uses an absurd amount of RAM. I have 32gb, at the time of writing this I have one window with 3 tabs open and firefox alone is using 64% of my RAM. This is less of a bug and more of a poor design/optimization choice ( I think) because with each passing update for a long time now firefox has become more and more needlessly resource tasking, so much so that it now requires more from my system than chrome and somehow even taxes my system more than most modern triple a games.

I tried running it in "safe mode" did nothing. I have since done a completely fresh install and even before having any add ons or changing any of the "about:config" settings the same problems still cropped up. Is anyone else experiencing this? I tend to stick with firefox because its what I have always known but the amount of problems I have had with numerous versions of firefox over the past 6 months alone heavily outnumbers the problems I have had with my experience with chrome,brave,safari,inernet explorer and puffin combined. Does anyone have any suggestions other than losing all of my data and add ons, doing a fresh install every 20 odd days and waiting for it to inevitably break again?
creator: howamo

title: Site Broken
content: This only affects one of my computers. The website https://www.arkadium.com/free-online-games/ is a site I enjoy playing on. For two of my computers, the site works great. For the one I'm currently on, though, when the video box appears (square black rectangle) it has the wheel of doom going and going for, literally, hours. The other systems sees the video and either plays an ad or not (depending if the site currently has ads available). Either way, after about 20 seconds the video page shows that the games will start is so many seconds. The problem computer does everything but finish and move on. No way to close that screen except to just close it out. I've checked the settings I can find that might apply but changing the settings does nothing new. I hope this isn't confusing. It's been a long day. I'd just like to play those games with this laptop. The attached screen shot is what I see after trying to open the site.

title: McAfee Blocked Site and Suspicious Activity by an app
content:
McAfee has notified me that a piece of software which is apparently from HP (HPUpdate within HP Framework) is trying to access a suspicious IP address (13.224.2.51).

An online search doesn't show this as being associated with HP but it is in an Amazon centre so it could be associated with almost anyone.

Is there anything in the Mozilla world which would help me determine whether this is a genuine problem or McAfee is just confused?

At this point my option seems to be to reinstall the my HP printer software and see what impact this has.

title: Auto Login issue
content: Hi, My browser started slowing down so I did the reset as suggested. Unfortunately, this changed the login settings and now when I go to my Gmail, Minds, mewe or other accounts is auto signs me in. I have gone into to settings and unchecked the auto fill and Ask to save logins and passwords for websites. That did nothing. I do not want any pages to auto login but I would like to be able to select a user name an password when I go to enter a webpage that requires one. Having the Auto login is a hug security issue for me. Can you please help.

title: a web site closes as soon as I open it
content:
I have 2 computers running Firefox, both running 104.0. This computer is windows 11 other windows 10.

Problem; Up until about a week ago I was able to click email links to open judicialwatch.org on this Win11 computer. Now, whenever I try to open that site (via link or direct entry) the tab closes immediately. From a link, I can see the tab open then close, from direct input it just closes when I hit enter. (The windows 10 computer has no problem.) I have searched for any settings that would show blocked web sites and cannot find any settings / listing of blocked web site. As the win11 is my primary computer, this is VERY annoying. Any help will be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Scott

I can still drag the sliders of the History sidebar and bookmark library though. Is this change intended? Or is my Firefox profile just messed up after the update?
